result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas Warren Zeiler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas Warren Zeiler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas Warren Zeiler was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

per court order. Faxed SCSO and Dispatch. gme
**Pymt Plan reinstated. jaf
423.00 FF, 15.00 PPF, $60.00 WF only. cah     Signed by SRN 3-16-17, c:DEF & SCSO. cah
CC: DA, Atty Firkus, DE, New Richmond PD. hml
DE appeared.  DE to pay $50/mo comm 6-15-16.  $15 PPF added.  DE signed PPA. jaf

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley  and student intern Nilushi Ranaweera.  DF ATTY:  Dan Firkus   DF:  Thomas Warren Zeiler appeared. Case called at 3:07 p.m. ADA Student Intern Nilushi Ranaweera recites joint recommendations. State has complied with victims rights. Atty Firkus in agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 2 Disorderly Conduct in 15CM452. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 Disorderly Conduct in 15CM452. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct's 1 & 3 in 15CM452. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file an appeal. 

Crt orders:

- Fine in the $630.00 plus misdemeanor court costs. $873.00 total. $250.00 bond to apply. Set up a payment plan. 

- DNA Sample and $200.00 DNA Surcharge

Plea/sentencing hearing on April 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial on May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Atty Firkus states DF is not prepared to plea today.  AODA Assessment scheduled 4/8/16. mba  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Daniel E. Firkus   DF:  Thomas Warren Zeiler appeared. Case called at 11:46 a.m. ADA McKinley states a resolution was mailed to the defendant as he was pro se. Atty Firkus was just retained and would like a new date. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 09:15 am.

and   _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant and guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $1,000.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Dawn H. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

ADA Collins makes sentencing arguements. Def responds. Court authorizes communication with J. Zeiler. km  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 11:45 am.
